body_html: @apaszke I think I may know the reason for that. The THPLongTensorClass is has THP_API flag on it, and then it will exist in the static library. But you specify extern here, it will look for it in the dynamic library, which will then fail. I can confirm this because I can find it in the export table of the earlier versions.
body_text: @apaszke I think I may know the reason for that. The THPLongTensorClass is has THP_API flag on it, and then it will exist in the static library. But you specify extern here, it will look for it in the dynamic library, which will then fail. I can confirm this because I can find it in the export table of the earlier versions.
body: @apaszke I think I may know the reason for that. The `THPLongTensorClass` is has `THP_API` flag on it, and then it will exist in the static library. But you specify `extern` here, it will look for it in the dynamic library, which will then fail. I can confirm this because I can find it in the export table of the earlier versions.
